text.value: **Press timer and count number of breaths for a full 60 seconds**
Immediately you put blood on the test strip, press the timer. The timer should run for 15 minutes after which you will read the results.
Immediately you put blood on the test strip, press the timer. The timer should run for 20 minutes after which you will read the results.
Feed the baby on only breast milk, on demand, at least 8 times a day.
Ensure the baby is well positioned and attached on the mother's breast.
2nd Immunization: 6 Weeks: DPT-HEPB-HIB 1; Pneomococcal Conjugate Vaccine 10 (PCV1); Rotavirus Vaccine 1
Wrap the baby in Warm, dry clothes including the head and feet
Put the baby in skin to skin contact with mother
Delay the baby's first bath untill after 24 hours
Wash hands before handling the baby
Bathe the baby with a clean cloth using clean soap and water
Do not apply anything on the cord. Leave the cord dry and open

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Patient must be under 5 years old

bind.calculate: concat( concat( /assessment/patient_age_in_years , if( /assessment/patient_age_in_years =1,' year and ',' years and ')), concat( /assessment/patient_age_in_months mod 12, if(( /assessment/patient_age_in_months mod 12)=1,' month old',' months old')) )

if( /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_danger_signs ='yes' or /assessment/group_patient_summary/cough_treatment_given ='no' or /assessment/group_patient_summary/diarrhoea_treatment_given ='no' or /assessment/group_patient_summary/fever_treatment_given ='no' or /assessment/group_cough/cough_danger_sign ='yes' or ( /assessment/group_breathing/fast_breathing ='true' and /assessment/group_cough/cough_duration >=14 ) or /assessment/group_diarrhoea/diarrhoea_danger_sign ='yes' or /assessment/group_fever/fever_danger_sign ='yes' or /assessment/group_hiv_tb/has_hiv_exposure ='yes' or /assessment/group_hiv_tb/has_tb_exposure ='yes' or /assessment/group_malnutrition/malnutrition_danger_sign ='yes', 'yes', 'no')

if( /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_danger_signs ='yes' or /assessment/group_cough/cough_danger_sign ='yes' or ( /assessment/group_breathing/fast_breathing ='true' and /assessment/group_cough/cough_duration >=14 ) or /assessment/group_diarrhoea/diarrhoea_danger_sign ='yes' or /assessment/group_fever/fever_danger_sign ='yes', 'yes', 'no')

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Date can't be more than 7 days ago. Also can't be a future date

bind.calculate: if(( /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_vomits_everything = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_convulsions = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_cannot_drink_breastfeed = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_unconscious = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_low_temp = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_yellow_eyes_or_palms = 'yes' or /assessment/group_danger_sign_screening/child_has_infected_umbilical_cord = 'yes'), 'yes', 'no')

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Breaths per minute must be between 10 and 120
The temperature should be between 33 °C and 42 °C

bind.relevant: /assessment/symptom_cough = '' and /assessment/symptom_indrawn_chest = '' and /assessment/symptom_fast_breathing = '' and /assessment/symptom_diarrhoea = '' and /assessment/symptom_fever = '' and /assessment/symptom_malaria_test = '' and ( /assessment/group_malnutrition/muac_colour != 'yellow' and /assessment/group_malnutrition/muac_colour != 'red') and /assessment/group_malnutrition/swelling_both_feet != 'yes'

group.label: General Danger Sign Screening for U5

input.label: Does have any of these signs?

select1.label: Does the child vomit everything they have eaten?
Does the child have convulsions?
Is the child Not able to drink and breastfeed
Is the child Very sleepy or unconscious/no movement
Does the child have no fever or low temperature (cold feet and hands)?
Does the child have Yellow eyes or palms?
Does the child have an Infected umbilical cord?
Does the child have a cough?

input.label: Note to VHT: If Cough is present Check for Fast Breathing

select1.label: How long has this cough lasted?
Does the child have chest in-drawing?

input.label: **Fast breathing depends on age** 0 to 7 day old: _60 or more breaths per minute._ 2 weeks to 11 months: _50 or more breaths per minute._ 12months to 5 years: _40 or more breaths per minute._
The client does not have fast breathing

select1.label: Does the child have diarrhoea (3 or more loose stools in 24hrs)?
How long has the diarrhoea lasted?
Is there blood in the stool?
Does the child have fever?
Do you have a thermometer?
How long has the fever lasted?

input.label: Do the Rapid Diagnostic Test for Malaria (mRDT)

select1.label: Which mRDT test are you using?
Rapid Malaria Tests Results

input.label: **Note to the VHT: Repeat an mRDT so the client is sure about their malaria diagnosis**

select1.label: Does the Child have any contact or exposure to HIV?
Does the Child have any contact or exposure to TB?

input.label: Use your MUAC tape to take the childs MUAC

select1.label: What is the colour of the MUAC tape?
Swelling of both feet of the child?
Does the Newborn appear to be too small for their age?
Is Child exclusively breastfeeding?
Is the client Walking or Crawling?

input.label: **Note: Please verify using the child's immunization card if they have received the 1st and 2nd immunizations. In rare cases when ther card is not available, ask the mother or caregiver to verify this by asking questions like Which side of the child's arm or leg was immunized?**

**1st Immunization:** 0-6 Weeks: Polio 0 & BCG
**2nd Immunization:** 6 Weeks: DPT-HEPB-HIB 1; Pneomococcal Conjugate Vaccine 10 (PCV1); Rotavirus Vaccine 1
**3rd Immunization:** 10 Weeks: Polio 2; DPT-HepB-Hib 2; Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine 10 (PCV 2); Rotavirus Vaccine 2
****4th Immunization:** 14 Weeks: Polio 3; Injectable Polio Vaccine (IPV); Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine 10 (PCV 3)
**5th Immunization:** 36 Weeks: Measles

select.label: Which Immunization has the child received?

item.label: 2nd Immunization: 6 Weeks: DPT-HEPB-HIB 1; Pneomococcal Conjugate Vaccine 10 (PCV1); Rotavirus Vaccine 1

select1.label: Is the child's Immunization up to date?

input.label: Encourage the care giver to take the child to the health facility for the missed vaccinations

select1.label: Has the child been dewormed in the last 6 months?
select1.hint: Children between 1-5 years are dewormed twice a year or every six months

input.label: Note: Vitamin A is given twice a year for U5s. Please verify using the child's health card or ask the mother to establish whether the child has received their Vitaimn A doses

select1.label: Has the child received their Vitamin A?
select1.hint: Vitamin A is given at 6 Months then every 6 Months after that until the child is 5 years old

select.label: Which Vitamin A dose has the child received?
select.hint: Vitamin A is given at 6 Months then every 6 Months after that until the child is 5 years old. The 2 doses should be received by the child during a calendar year

input.label: Advice Mother to ensure that the child receives Vitamin A

item.label: Wrap the baby in Warm, dry clothes including the head and feet
Put the baby in skin to skin contact with mother
Delay the baby's first bath untill after 24 hours
Wash hands before handling the baby
Bathe the baby with a clean cloth using clean soap and water
Do not apply anything on the cord. Leave the cord dry and open
Feed the baby on only breast milk, on demand, at least 8 times a day.
Ensure the baby is well positioned and attached on the mother's breast.

input.label: Be sure you Submit to complete this action.
Child is not able to drink and breastfeed
Child has no fever/ low temperature (cold feet and hands)
Child has an Infected umbilical cord

Treat with Amoxicillin 250mg
1 tab from the pack

Treat with Amoxicillin 250mg
2 Tabs from the pack
Give the first dose before you refer

select1.label: Has been given prereferral treatment for cough?

input.label:
1. Treat with ORS
2. 5 to 10 tablespoonfuls after every loose stool
10 to 20 tablespoonfuls after every loose stool
Begin giving the child ORS before you refer. Advise caregiver to continue giving ORS to the child on the way to the health centre.

select1.label: Has been given prereferral treatment for diarrhoea?

input.label:
Treat with oral Anti-malarial ACT
1 Tab from the pack

Treat with oral Anti-malarial ACT
2 Tabs from the pack
Give first dose of oral Anti-Malarial ACT before you refer

select1.label: Has been given prereferral treatment for fever?
Has been given prereferral treatment for general danger sign?

input.label: Newborn with danger sign: REFER and transport in skin to skin position
Treat with Oral Antibiotic - Amoxicilline 250 mgs

1 tab
twice a day
for 5 days from the PACK
(1 strip of 10 tabs)

2 tabs
twice a day
for 5 days from the PACK
(2 strips of 10 tabs)
Help the caregiver give the first dose now.

select1.label: Has been given treatment for cough?

input.label: Give ORS. Help caregiver give child ORS solution in front of you until the child is no longer thirsty.
Give caregiver an ORS and Zinc COPACK to take home Advise the caregiver to give as much as child wants, but at least ½ cup ORS solution after each loose stool.

Treat with Zinc supplement as follows
1/2 a tablet
Once a day
For 10 days
Total 5 tablets

Treat with Zinc supplement
1 tablet
Once a day
For 10 days
Total 10 tablets
Demonstrate to the caregiver how to give the first dose

Encourage caregiver to give small sips of ORS frequently from a cup. If the child vomits, wait for 10 minutes, then continue giving fluids, but more slowly. If the child can take more, encourage the caregiver to continue giving.

select1.label: Has been given treatment for diarrhoea?

input.label: Help the caregiver give the first dose now.
Advise caregiver to give 2nd dose after 8 hrs and to give dose twice daily for 2 more days

select1.label: Has been given treatment for fever?

input.label: Refer to a health facility

select1.label: Have you referred

input.label:
Help caregiver give first dose now
Advise caregiver to give more fluids by breastfeeding more and for longer at each feed (If Child <= 6 Months). care giver should also give and plenty of homemade fluids such as:
Rice water, soup, Yoghurt drinks, Light porridge
Advise to go to the health facility if the child:
Cannot drink, feed or has blood in stool
In-contact with someone on TB treatment
Advise the caregiver to finish the course of the treatment even if the child gets better
Advise caregiver to ensure the child sleeps under a mosquito net.
Advise caregiver if needed, when and where is the next vaccine to be given
Ask to see the child again in 3 days and 6 days in follow up visits even if the child improves
Follow up the child in 3 days to ensure the child went to the nearest health facility for treatment
